title: Expose `ConfiguredTarget.getConfigurationKey()` to Starlark (at least aspects)

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

body:
### Description of the feature request:


In [rules_xcodeproj](https://github.com/MobileNativeFoundation/rules_xcodeproj) and another IDE integration I'm working on I have a need for knowing the configuration hash of a target in an aspect.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


I need this over `ctx.bin_dir` because I need a truly unique identifier for a configured target. If a target is differently configured multiple times, but any of them output to the same path, the IDE integration will have no way of being able to build those targets (not at the same time mind you, I understand that could result in action conflict errors).

The integration uses this identifier in a name of an output group to be able to build differently configured versions of the same target (configured via different top-level target transitions or a single 1:N split transition).

Added bonus of being `ConfiguredTarget.getConfigurationKey()` versus some other hash, is that a user can debug issues with targets by using that hash directly in `cquery`.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


macOS
